summary: Anand Ingalgi, a renowned journalist of his times would have written a book EL DORADO on the biggest kept secret in Indian history -- KGF. The government of India would not have permitted him to publish the book for various reasons. But Deepa Hegde accidentally gets her hands on a half-burnt book and listens to half the story from Anand which is KGF Chapter 1. Before Anand could narrate the remaining, he suffers a stroke and is in hospital. Deepa finds Vijayendra Ingalgi, Anand's Son at the hospital who then narrates the remaining story from the research library of Anand Ingalgi. Why did the government burn down the copies of Anand's Book EL DORADO and not allow it to be published? Does Rocky, who at the end of KGF Chapter 1, survive? Does Rocky give a fresh ray of life to the people of KGF? Why does KGF become one of the biggest issues for the government?

reviews.content: Only 60% gold. Noise, noise and more noise. Multiple trailers stitched together. Headache worthy, but also one-time watch doesn't hurt.

A larger-than-life, highly enjoyable rags to riches, urchin to overlord movie. The dialogue is cutting and immensely funny, the action is out of this world, and the emotional storyline is very moving. Kash plays Rocky brilliantly, and Sanjay Dutt is an amazing nemesis. The movie seems like a modern-day myth, or a lost city of El Dorado and its untold riches. Brilliant and definitely worth sitting through the epic 5-hour story.

Well I liked the film for the uniqueness of the characters, story and cinematography in KGF. A Kannada film of this huge is one of a kind, not only that one of the biggest film during these pandemic times. Loved every bit of it. What I disliked was just a bit of VFX here and there, that's it.

K.G.F Chapter 2 is a letdown for me as compared to chapter 1. While Yash rocks as rocky he loses out on the charming humor due to the lack of laughs in the script making this installment less fun. The action sequences are bigger this time around, but again it loses out on the oomph factor with its execution. In chapter 1, Rocky was more of an assassin, a one-man show who played smart to get the job done, this time around either he walks with an army behind him or just walks alone without any plans, which does give us some thrilling sequences but overall way over the top.  Still a fun watch and hoping for Chapter 3.

Literally the best and most impactful movie I've ever seen. And The Man Rocking Star Yash did it what nobody ever could. Hats off for the whole team of kgf 2 and Thank u for sharing ur outstanding masterpiece. Kgf was a hell of a ride. Can't wait for Chapter 3. Bring it on already. We are rooting

Again, those Hindi India movies are state of the art, as good as anyone. As usual in such India movies, very loud thunderous music, as another reviewer said, and 'hypermasculine' characterizations.

THE BLOCKBUSTER OF THE YEAR 2022!!!! The movie is getting hate by everyone for no reason. Had a better storyline than RRR, and the cinematography will make you remember Zach Snyder. The character bonding of Reena and Rocky could be improved as it would have caused more effect in the end. Overall, a great sequal!!!!

What is wrong with people right now? And ths is today, not yesterday. How can this movie be hailed? Or even encouraged? 

Absolute nonsense of a movie. If one were to blindly beleve that the proragonist is immortal, then why bother with all the extravagant setup for fights when we all know what s going to happen. 

At numerous times in the movie, Rocky could have been killed by an amateur shooter. Yet the movie contnous in its mindless indulgence of voilence and fight scenes with only one inevitable result. 

Even the ending is so undeniably egoistic and absolutely comical. I am not sure what movies are supposed to be anymore. Is it supposed to entertain the audience. Because, it sure as hell didnt do that. 

The only thing ths movie is successful is in immortaliznig the protagonist and the actor 'Yash' 

Absolute joke of a movie. I am absolutely disappointed with the audience of this world. 

Thankfully I watched it on TV, where I could skip the unbearable parts.

"K.G.F: Chapter 2" knows exactly what it is and for that, I have to give it props. This is a movie completely focused on insane action scenes without any real emphasis on realism. The movie is a lot of fun and I think technically better than the first one. I feel like both movies suffer from way too much going on and just a bit too much goofiness, but all in all, they're a good time. I think this movie engaged me plenty and had a lot of solid entertainment value. Overall, I think it is a slight step up from the last one and I would fully be on board seeing the third part as it does set up for one after the credits roll.

The first chapter established the tone for a polished gangster film franchise with a lot of flair and attention to detail. With its advertising video that gives a sneak peak inside the film, the second instalment has managed to generate buzz. Is it able to compete with that? It does, and it gives fans a stronger sequel as well as a significant surprise at the climax. For more movie reviews and download kindly visit us at strending.com

Congratulations & Hatts Off to the Writer-Director PRASHANT NEEL for making this masterpiece and creating his perfect vision and bringing to the audience. Before KGF I've could've never imagine that Kannada Cinema could create such masterpiece but it's all Over Now. From Now On this is the INDIAN CINEMA. Execution & the way director has present the KGF story is just brilliant. It's 2 hrs 48 mins long movie but the screenplay is so fast paced that no one can imagine how this time has passed. Performance of all the actors and supporting cast has just nailed it. YASH is not a star HE IS THE REAL MONSTER when it comes to acting and his presence in the movie and so as SANJAY DUTT. 
BGM & ACTION SEQUENCES are just too damn good that it can't be ignored. Specially the climax is just too good. Wait for the post credit scene and see the surprise for yourself. Prashant Neel has given the perfect TREAT to the cinema lovers by Creating the world of KGF..
Worth watching more than once, truly. Satisfying must watch experience.  Don’t miss End Credits East er Egg surprise!!

Its a wonderfully crafted fictional Mass entertainer. These words would explain the whole movie altogether.
There are two types of movie audience type and critic type. I'm a type of person who loves critic type of movie. But this one here clearly belongs audience and I loved it. I would like to appreciate the director for tricking me to forget abt logic and convinced me to enjoy the Movie irrespective of  the flaws it has got. The narrative, Visuals, background score, writing of screenplay are the huge plus factor. He has given more importance to the writing. Screenplay is so engaging that you will have no time to think abt all those logics. Backed by constant BGM and Wonderful cinematography. (they never let their director down throughout movie)
I understand if a critic gives less ratings, but you can't deny the fact that adrenaline rush your body went through while watching this movie. I know its not a perfect movie but I love the way it made me feel.
